title: Roman Numerals
description: Test your ability to read and convert Roman numerals!

questions.question: What number does the Roman numeral 'X' represent?
questions.explanation: X represents 10 in Roman numerals. It is one of the seven basic symbols used in the system.

questions.question: What is the Roman numeral for 50?
questions.explanation: L represents 50 in Roman numerals. The seven basic Roman numeral symbols are I (1), V (5), X (10), L (50), C (100), D (500), and M (1000).

questions.question: What number does 'XV' represent?
questions.explanation: XV equals 15. When a smaller numeral follows a larger one, you add them: X (10) + V (5) = 15.

questions.question: How would you write 3 in Roman numerals?
questions.explanation: 3 is written as III in Roman numerals â€” three ones added together.

questions.question: What number does 'IV' represent?
questions.explanation: IV equals 4. When a smaller numeral precedes a larger one, you subtract: V (5) - I (1) = 4.

questions.question: What number does 'XC' represent?
questions.explanation: XC equals 90. X (10) before C (100) means subtraction: 100 - 10 = 90.

questions.question: How would you write 40 in Roman numerals?
questions.explanation: 40 is written as XL. X (10) before L (50) means subtraction: 50 - 10 = 40. Romans never used four of the same symbol in a row.

questions.question: How would you write 99 in Roman numerals?
questions.explanation: 99 is written as XCIX. XC (90) + IX (9) = 99. The subtractive principle only works with specific pairs.

questions.question: How would you write 1999 in Roman numerals?
questions.explanation: 1999 is written as MCMXCIX. M (1000) + CM (900) + XC (90) + IX (9) = 1999.

questions.question: What number does 'MMCDLXXVIII' represent?
questions.explanation: MMCDLXXVIII equals 2478. MM (2000) + CD (400) + LXX (70) + VIII (8) = 2478.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid Roman numeral representation?
questions.explanation: VX is not valid. In Roman numerals, V (5) cannot be used as a subtractive prefix. Only I, X, and C can be used subtractively.
